byline.contributor: Gene Palumbo contributed reporting from San Salvador.

abstract: Gen Carlos Eugenio Vides Casanova is deported from United States over his role in human rights abuses during his tenure as defense minister of El Salvador; Casanova is highest-ranking official to be deported following passage of 2004 law meant to keep those guilty of abuses from seeking refuge in US.
lead_paragraph: The expulsion of Gen. Carlos Eugenio Vides Casanova is part of a battle by rights advocates to hold him accountable for his role in the 1980 murders of four American churchwomen.

headline.main: U.S. Deports Salvadoran General Accused in ’80s Killings
headline.print_headline: U.S. Deports Salvadoran for Role in ’80s Killings

snippet: The expulsion of Gen. Carlos Eugenio Vides Casanova is part of a battle by rights advocates to hold him accountable for his role in the 1980 murders of four American churchwomen.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
